structured.description: A Spring Boot application that uses the BCrypt password encryption algorithm for securely storing and hashing passwords. The `getPasswordEncoder()` method returns a `BCryptPasswordEncoder` instance, which is used to encrypt passwords. The application also includes configuration properties scanning using `@ConfigurationPropertiesScan`.

}

items.description: is a Java class that provides a BCryptPasswordEncoder instance for encrypting passwords using the BCrypt algorithm. The encoder is designed to handle strong password validation and is suitable for use in web applications.
items.name: MyHomeServiceApplication
items.doc: A Spring Boot application that uses the BCrypt password encryption algorithm for securely storing and hashing passwords. The `getPasswordEncoder()` method returns a `BCryptPasswordEncoder` instance, which is used to encrypt passwords. The application also includes configuration properties scanning using `@ConfigurationPropertiesScan`.

items.description: runs a Spring application named `MyHomeServiceApplication`. It starts the application using the `SpringApplication.run()` method, passing in the class and command-line arguments.

params.name: args
params.description:
command-line arguments passed to the `SpringApplication.run()` method when the application is launched.

* `args`: an array of strings representing command-line arguments passed to the application
* `MyHomeServiceApplication`: the name of the application class being executed

items.name: main

The `getPasswordEncoder()` method returns a `BCryptPasswordEncoder` instance, which is used to encrypt passwords. The application also includes configuration properties scanning using `@ConfigurationPropertiesScan`.
